alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:04PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wasatch... northwestern Duchesne and southwestern Summit Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 203 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Timber Lakes, or 10 miles southeast of Heber City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Heber City, Heber, Kamas, Oakley, Francis, Daniel, Samak, Mirror Lake, Timber Lakes, Midway, Charleston, Wallsburg, Peoa, Woodland, Trial Lk, Marion, Hailstone, Jordanelle Reservoir and Deer Creek State Park. This includes the following highways... US Route 40 between mile markers 13 and 39. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 23. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains
